File

File
DumpFile
ResultFile
TopologyFile

Provides a class to handle a file

Files are splittet into a line array and a comments array.

The line array contains all the main information.

The comments array contains all comments and empty lines.

This class implements an iterator pattern to iterate through the lines of a file

Summary

setLineSets a line in line array

addLinesAppends an array of lines to the line array
addCommentLineAppends a line to the comments array

getFirstLineGrepReturns the first line that matches a regular expression
getIndexFirstLineGrepReturns the index of the first line that matches a regular expression
hasLinesReturns true if line pointer has not reached the end of the line array
getNextLineReturns actual line and increments line pointer

clearCommentsDeletes all lines from comments array
clearFileDeletes all lines from line array and comments array

setNameSets the name of the file (without suffix)
getFileTypeReturns suffix of filename
setFileTypeSets suffix of filename
getLengthReturns the number of lines in the line array
printPrints the whole file to STDOUT.

Variables

Member variables

linesarray of lines that contain main informations
commentsarray of lines that contain comments and empty lines
linepointerinteger that holds the index of the actual line (needed for iterator pattern)
paththe path to the file includes filename
directorythe location of the file
filenamename of the file includes filtype
namename of the file without filetype
filtypetype of the file

new

sub new

Constructor

PARAMETERS

$pathToFilepath to the file represented by the object

readFile

sub readFile

Reads file into an array of lines and an array of comments

filterFile

sub filterFile

Deletes all lines of the file that are empty or comments

writeFile

sub writeFile

Write array of lines to file

getLineArray

sub getLineArray

Returns the whole array of lines of the file

setLineArray

sub setLineArray

Sets the wohle array of lines given as argument

New lines are automaticaly split into several lines

PARAMETERS; @lines - array of lines to set

getCommentArray

sub getCommentArray

Returns the comments array

setCommentArray

sub setCommentArray

Sets the comments array

New lines are automaticaly split into several lines

PARAMETERS; @lines - array of lines to set

getLine

sub getLine

Returns a line from line array

PARAMETERS

$indexnumber of line to return (index of linearray)

setLine

sub setLine

Sets a line in line array

PARAMETERS

$indexnumber of line to set
$linestring to set this line to

addLine

sub addLine

Appends a line to the line array

PARAMETERS

$linestring to append

addLines

sub addLines

Appends an array of lines to the line array

PARAMETERS

@toAddstring to append

addCommentLine

sub addCommentLine

Appends a line to the comments array

PARAMETERS

$linestring to append

getLinesGrep

sub getLinesGrep

Returns an array of lines that match a regular expression

PARAMETERS

$regularExpressionregular expression that should match some lines

getFirstLineGrep

sub getFirstLineGrep

Returns the first line that matches a regular expression

PARAMETERS

$regularExpressionregular expression that should match at least one line

getIndexFirstLineGrep

sub getIndexFirstLineGrep

Returns the index of the first line that matches a regular expression

PARAMETERS

$regularExpressionregular expression that should match at least one line

hasLines

sub hasLines

Returns true if line pointer has not reached the end of the line array

This function is part of an iterator pattern implementation

getNextLine

sub getNextLine

Returns actual line and increments line pointer

If the line pointer has reached the end of the line array, the last line is returned

This function is part of an iterator pattern implementation

clearLines

sub clearLines

Deletes all lines from line array

clearComments

sub clearComments

Deletes all lines from comments array

clearFile

sub clearFile

Deletes all lines from line array and comments array

resetLinePointer

sub resetLinePointer

Sets the line pointer to 0.

This function is part of an iterator pattern implementation

getActualIndex

sub getActualIndex

Returns the actual linepointer (=index).

This function is part of an iterator pattern implementation

getPath

sub getPath

Returns the path to the file

setPath

sub setPath

Sets the path to the file

The variables directory, filename, name and filetype gets updated.

If path is “-” then path, filename and name are set to “-” and filetype is set to “STDOUT”

getFileName

sub getFileName

Returns the filename of the represented file

setFileName

sub setFileName

Sets filename of the file

The directory stays the same.  The variables name, filetype and path gets updated

getDirectory

sub getDirectory

Returns the directory the file is stored at

setDirectory

sub setDirectory

Sets directory the file is stored at

Variable path gets updated

getName

sub getName

Returns Name of the file (without suffix)

setName

sub setName

Sets the name of the file (without suffix)

Variables path and filename gets updated

getFileType

sub getFileType

Returns suffix of filename

setFileType

sub setFileType

Sets suffix of filename

Variables path and filename gets updated

getLength

sub getLength

Returns the number of lines in the line array

print

sub print

Prints the whole file to STDOUT.

_checkFile

sub _checkFile

Empty function that must be implemented by all specialised classes.  Should implement a syntax check.

addLineToFile

sub addLineToFile

Adds a line to a file

This is a static function and can be called without a file object.  If calles with a file object the associated file is not touched.

PARAMETERS

$fileNamepath the to file the line should be added to
$lineline that should be added
